docs.title: Phase Documentation
docs.text:
Phase helps groups coordinate schedules without exposing event details. It connects to Google Calendar using FreeBusy, supports group availability, and offers a synced export calendar.

Get started How sync works Availability basics

Privacy by design

Phase only stores busy ranges, not event titles, attendees, or descriptions.

docs.title: What you can do
docs.text:
• Sign in with Google
  • Sync availability (FreeBusy only)
  • Create or join groups
  • Add Available or Blocked times
  • Propose meetups with conflict warnings
  • Export a synced group calendar to Google

docs.title: Core principles
docs.text:
• Privacy first: only FreeBusy data is fetched
  • Transparency: users can see exactly what is shared
  • Collaboration: group members see availability with color coding

docs.title: FreeBusy error: timeRangeTooLong
docs.text: Phase chunks requests into 90‑day windows. Ensure you’re on the latest code.

docs.title: OAuth mismatching_state
docs.text: Clear cookies and restart Flask. Ensure redirect URI matches exactly.

docs.title: Sync fails with 401
docs.text: Refresh token missing. Re‑login to Google.

docs.title: Build errors
docs.text:
npm install
npm run build

docs.title: Calendar styling missing
docs.text:
Ensure app/static/schedule-x.css exists by running: 

npm run build:calendar

docs.title: Postgres missing columns
docs.text: Run the schema update SQL in Render (see Database setup).

docs.title: API Overview
docs.text: High‑level endpoints used by the frontend:

docs.title: Sync & calendars
docs.text:
• POST /api/sync/me → sync FreeBusy (6 months)
  • GET /api/calendars → list calendars
  • POST /api/calendars/selection → save selection

docs.title: Events
docs.text:
• GET /api/groups/<id>/events → calendar data for Schedule-X
  • POST /api/groups/<id>/special → add available/blocked
  • POST /api/groups/<id>/proposal → propose meetup

docs.title: Export
docs.text:
• GET /api/groups/<id>/export/google/options
  • POST /api/groups/<id>/export/google

docs.title: Group management
docs.text:
• POST /groups/<id>/settings
  • POST /groups/<id>/join-code/regenerate

docs.title: Available / Blocked
docs.text:
Users can add: - Available: time slots they are free - Blocked: time slots they are unavailable

These appear on the group calendar with distinct colors.

docs.title: Propose Meetup
docs.text: Members can propose a time: - Optional location & description - Conflict warnings shown if other members are busy

docs.title: Tips
docs.text:
• Select a time range on the calendar before opening dialogs.
  • Proposals do not modify personal calendars until exported.

docs.title: Export to Google Calendar
docs.text: Phase can create or update a synced Google Calendar for a group.

docs.title: Options
docs.text:
• Calendar name (default: Phase - <Group Name>)
  • Timezone
  • Per‑member colors
  • Invite members to the calendar
  • Overwrite existing Phase events

docs.title: Notes
docs.text:
• Exported events include busy blocks, special events, and proposals.
  • Events are tagged so Phase can update or replace them later.
  • Export requires Google Calendar write access.

docs.title: Create / Join
docs.text:
• Create a group to generate a join code.
  • Join with a code or invite link.

docs.title: Roles
docs.text:
• Admin: manage group settings, promote members, export calendar.
  • Member: view availability, add time ranges, propose meetups.

docs.title: Settings
docs.text: Admins can update: - Group name - Join code - Timezone

docs.title: Invite links
docs.text: Invite links are time-limited and can be regenerated anytime.

docs.title: Calendar Sync (FreeBusy)
docs.text: Phase syncs only FreeBusy data.

docs.title: How it works
docs.text:
• Fetches availability from selected Google calendars
  • Stores busy ranges only
  • Client-side auto-sync is optional
  • Server-side background refresh runs every 15 minutes

docs.title: Sync range
docs.text:
• Now → 6 months
  • Split into 90‑day chunks to avoid Google API limits

docs.title: Privacy
docs.text: No event titles, descriptions, or attendees are accessed.

docs.title: Calendar selection
docs.text: Only calendars you select in the Sync dialog are included in FreeBusy requests.

docs.title: Build frontend assets
docs.text:
npm run build

Outputs: - app/static/main.bundle.js - app/static/schedule-x.css - app/static/styles.css

docs.title: Run backend
docs.text: python run.py

docs.title: Database Setup
docs.text: Phase runs on SQLite by default, but supports Postgres for production.

docs.title: SQLite (default)
docs.text: DATABASE_URL=sqlite:///app.db

docs.title: Postgres (local via Docker)
docs.text:
Start Postgres: 

docker-compose up -d

Use: 

DATABASE_URL=postgresql://phase_user:phase_pass@localhost:5432/phase

docs.title: Render Postgres
docs.text:
If your DB already exists, run the schema update: 

ALTER TABLE groups
  ADD COLUMN IF NOT EXISTS timezone VARCHAR(64),
  ADD COLUMN IF NOT EXISTS synced_calendar_id VARCHAR(255),
  ADD COLUMN IF NOT EXISTS synced_calendar_name VARCHAR(255),
  ADD COLUMN IF NOT EXISTS synced_calendar_tz VARCHAR(64);

ALTER TABLE memberships
  ADD COLUMN IF NOT EXISTS google_color_id VARCHAR(8);

docs.title: Requirements
docs.text:
• Python 3.10+
  • Node.js 18+
  • npm

docs.title: Install dependencies
docs.text:
pip install -r requirements.txt
npm install

docs.title: Configure environment
docs.text:
Create a .env file in the repo root: 

FLASK_ENV=development
FLASK_DEBUG=1
SECRET_KEY=dev_secret_change_me
APP_BASE_URL=http://127.0.0.1:5000
DATABASE_URL=sqlite:///app.db
GOOGLE_CLIENT_ID=...
GOOGLE_CLIENT_SECRET=...

Tip

You can start without Google OAuth by running in demo mode. Set FLASK_DEBUG=1 and use the demo group.

docs.title: Build frontend assets
docs.text: npm run build

docs.title: Run the app
docs.text:
python run.py

App runs at: http://127.0.0.1:5000

docs.title: Google OAuth Setup
docs.text:
1) Create a Google Cloud project 2) Enable Google Calendar API 3) Configure OAuth consent screen 4) Create OAuth Client ID (Web App) 5) Add redirect URI: 

http://127.0.0.1:5000/auth/callback

Set these env vars: 

GOOGLE_CLIENT_ID=...
GOOGLE_CLIENT_SECRET=...

Scopes used: - openid, email, profile - https://www.googleapis.com/auth/calendar.readonly - https://www.googleapis.com/auth/calendar (for export)

Tip

Make sure the redirect URI matches exactly, including scheme and port.
